definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
to see/to meet/to appear (to be sth)/to interview

sentences.english: I am an honest and kind minded man.
sentences.chinese: 我是一个诚实，善良，没有门户之见的人。

sentences.english: The presidential candidate seemed to be very partisan.
sentences.chinese: 这名总统候选人的门户之见似乎很深。

definition: to be a stickler for formalities/to rigidly adhere to/to cling to/constrained/ill at ease
scholars tend to disparage one another (idiom)
to swallow ancient learning without digesting it (idiom)/to be pedantic without having a mastery of one's subject
to value the broom as one's own (idiom); to attach value to sth because it is one's own/a sentimental attachment
opposition between vital energy 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4] and pathogeny 邪氣|邪气[xie2 qi4] (TCM)
